newsitem.title: UK: British Biotech in deal with Japan's Tanabe.
newsitem.headline: British Biotech in deal with Japan's Tanabe.

text.p: British pharmaceutical group Biotech Plc said on Thursday it has signed a deal with Japan's Tanabe Seiyaku Co Ltd to develop the UK firm's oral anti-cancer drug, Marimastat, in Japan.
British Biotech said in a statement it received an initial payment of $7.0 million from Tanabe, to be followed by up to a further $67 million.
British Biotech also said it expected to receive significant payments under a revenue-sharing plan covering Tanabe's sales of the drug in Japan.

Tanabe, which will receive exclusive marketing rights to the drug, will assume development of it in Japan and was expected to start trials with cancer patients next year. Marimastat, British Biotech's most important drug, is currently in a series of Phase III clinical trials in cancer patients in Europe and North America.
British Biotech's shares were marked up three pence at 238.5 pence by 0825.
